page.title: 16Cleeve Abbey
page.content: This beautiful old builiding in its truly lovely setting is a well known{tourist attraction. }This is how it is described in the local guide. "Washford is the place from which to visit the splendid remains of Cleeve Abbey, the only{Cistercian } foundation in Somerset, and once the most flourishing monastery in the county. Today, under the guardianship of the{Department of the {Environment,}this treasure in stone is carefully preserved, though at one time it housed cattle and farm implements. There are marvellously preserved cloisters, refectory, chapter-house and common room." {The grounds of this Abbey provide {the venue for the local First Schools {Festival of Country Dancing.
